page.title: 03FARMING
page.content:
The second of the four farms we studied was Townhead Farm Holytown. It has 300 acres which is all owned.This farm also concentrated on a mixture of dairy and arable farming.Their livestock consisted of dairy cattle-fresian,which they milked twice a day, at 5.45am and 3.45 pm .
The soil type of the farm was medium and they sold most of their products,oats,barley,wheat,milk and straw,with the exception of grass which they used themselves for silage . The farm employed six people,four of which were part-time workers,and they had all the usual type of machinery.
